rename.from: Timeout or Termination functionality for Passive Scanning
rename.to: Enhancement: Timeout or Termination functionality for Passive Scanning

body: The passive scanners usually "hang" because of regular expressions with big responses. An option to allow to specify the maximum size of the bodies to passive scan should go along with this.

issue.title: ZAP, Docker, Baseline: One of the alpha passive scans breaks the baseline scan - hangs + 100% CPU

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
I just tried to use docker zap baseline scan with alpha scans, it hangs in my configuration.
The docker image: `owasp/zap2docker-weekly    latest    349d66640c63    2 days ago    1.5GB`

I executed `docker run -v /wd:/zap/wrk/:rw -t owasp/zap2docker-weekly zap-baseline.py -a -d -m 2 -t https://XXXXXXX.at -g gen.conf -r testreport.html -w testreport.md`

The script hangs while giving this output:
```
2017-10-07 10:22:37,169 Starting new HTTP connection (1): localhost
2017-10-07 10:22:37,170 http://localhost:43752 "GET http://zap/JSON/pscan/view/recordsToScan/ HTTP/1.1" 200 24
2017-10-07 10:22:37,171 Starting new HTTP connection (1): localhost
2017-10-07 10:22:37,172 http://localhost:43752 "GET http://zap/JSON/pscan/view/recordsToScan/ HTTP/1.1" 200 24
2017-10-07 10:22:37,172 Records to passive scan : 1082
2017-10-07 10:22:39,173 Starting new HTTP connection (1): localhost
2017-10-07 10:22:39,174 http://localhost:43752 "GET http://zap/JSON/pscan/view/recordsToScan/ HTTP/1.1" 200 24
2017-10-07 10:22:39,176 Starting new HTTP connection (1): localhost
2017-10-07 10:22:39,176 http://localhost:43752 "GET http://zap/JSON/pscan/view/recordsToScan/ HTTP/1.1" 200 24
2017-10-07 10:22:39,177 Records to passive scan : 1082
```

This output is repeated over and over again, I need to kill the docker container. The java process in the docker runs on 100% CPU.

Without the `-a` flag the scan completes.

body: I'm sad to see that this issue's milestone is now 2.9.0, it makes passive scanning unusable in a lot of contexts.
@nil0x42 PRs are still being accepted for 2.8.0! We're a relatively small team and are focussing on releasing 2.8.0, so all contributions appreciated :)

issue.title: Enhancement: Mechanism to disable Wappalyzer

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
As Wappalyzer can often end-up being a passive scanner which results in the greater than 5sec log messages it would be nice if there was a mechanism by which it could be disabled. Ex:
>123739 [ZAP-PassiveScanner] WARN org.zaproxy.zap.extension.pscan.PassiveScanThread  - Passive Scan rule Wappalyzer Scanner (Tech Detection) took 16 seconds to scan https://redacted.com/en text/html; charset=utf-8 244603
130059 [ZAP-PassiveScanner] WARN org.zaproxy.zap.extension.pscan.PassiveScanThread  - Passive Scan rule Wappalyzer Scanner (Tech Detection) took 6 seconds to scan https://redacted.com/CommonElements/js/jquery-3.1.1.min.js application/javascript 86709

Either it needs to be converted to a `PluginPassiveScanner` so that it can be disabled in the standard passive scan rule options panel, or it needs a button added to it's toolbar (or new options panel) tied to `PassiveScanner.setEnabled()`.

I'm leaning towards the second option.

issue.title: Allow to define the maximum body size to passive scan

issue.body:
Partly addresses #3813

Not sure how to add unit tests for this :/
